text: What is the best way to implement a python program that will take a string and will output its result according to operator precedence (for example: "4+3*5" will output 19).
I've googled for ways to solve this problem but they were all too complex, and I'm looking for a (relatively) simple one.

clarification: I need something slightly more advanced than eval() - I want to be able to add other operators (for example a maximum operator - 4$2 = 4) or, also I am more interested in this academically than professionaly - I want to know how to do this.
